name: Clownfish
description: Clownfish are small, brightly colored fish known for their symbiotic relationship with sea anemones.
habitat: Warm waters of the Indian and Pacific Oceans, including the Red Sea and the Great Barrier Reef.

name: Betta
description: Bettas, also known as Siamese fighting fish, are popular aquarium fish recognized by their vibrant colors and flowing fins.
habitat: Shallow waters in Thailand, Cambodia, Laos, and Vietnam, such as rice paddies and marshes.

name: Goldfish
description: Goldfish are freshwater fish in the carp family, one of the most commonly kept aquarium fish.
habitat: Native to East Asia, now domesticated worldwide in freshwater ponds and aquariums.

name: Angelfish
description: Freshwater angelfish are popular for their unique, triangular body shape and long, graceful fins.
habitat: Tropical South America, including much of the Amazon River basin.

name: Guppy
description: Guppies are small, colorful freshwater fish, widely kept as pets and known for their prolific breeding.
habitat: Northeast South America, now introduced to many habitats and found worldwide.
